2. The system includes a heat insulating packer and stainless steel collars to contain heat in the production zone, focusing it on the formation itself and allowing viscous materials to flow to the well bore for pumping.

3. The heating unit is designed to prevent electrical problems caused by physical and chemical attack of electrical connections and invasion of conductive fluids, with features such as a cement block encasing the heater rods and a steel fitting assembly to shield the electrical connections.

4. The method of use for the system involves installing the heat-retaining elements and suitably shielded electrical connections, and may also involve substituting cable for down hole pipe to support the heating unit while pipe is pulled from the well bore.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention relates to down hole tools for conducting mechanical activities in wells, specifically a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including objects that might be stuck or lost within a well bore.

2. The mechanism is designed to effectively connect a pull tool to a down hole object or fish and to simply and effectively disconnect the pull tool from the article if desired.

3. The invention is particularly useful in cases where the pulling tool or wire line is inadequate for the pulling operations that are required, and it is necessary to disconnect the pulling tool from the fish and replace it with a wire line controlled pulling tool of substantially greater pulling capacity.

4. The mechanism includes an external pull tool or overshot that is adapted for use in well servicing operations or an internal pull tool or spear, depending upon the particular service operation that is involved.

5. The tool structure takes the form of an outer tubular body having an inner body structure disposed in movable relation therein, with telescoping movement of the inner and outer body structures causing the overshot or spear to selectively move into gripping relationship with the object to be removed from the well bore.

6. The mechanism includes a catch mechanism having a locking position and an unlocking position, depending upon the relative positions of the inner and outer body structures, and a pin structure forming a part of the catch mechanism is selectively positioned within pin receiving grooves.

7. The mechanism also includes a control spring that ensures the pin alternately enters one or the other of a pair of unlocking or locking grooves each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly relative to one another.

8. The mechanism allows for controlled latching and unlatching of the pulling tool mechanism, with the guide pin being moved upwardly or downwardly within the recess to achieve latching or unlatching configuration.

9. The mechanism can be used in a variety of down hole service operations, including installation and removal of down hole tools and fishing operations for stuck or lost tools within the well bore.

</summary>

<summary>
1. The present application claims the benefit of a PCT International Patent Application Ser. No. PCT/MX2011/000063 filed on May 25, 2011, which in turn claims priority to co-pending Mexico patent application Ser. Nos. MX/a/2011/005499 and MX/a/2010/005899.

2. The invention relates to stave floors, specifically to modular composed stave floors, and aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate.

3. The conventional composed stave floors have a thin sight substrate thickness (2-3 mm), which makes them prone to deformation and detachment upon being sanded or rushed.

4. The conventional composed stave floors also have a base substrate composed of slung wood or plated against (triplay), which are joined by glue, but this method has several disadvantages, including deformations and changes in dimensions.

5. The invention proposes a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with a sight substrate having a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate having a thickness of at least 12 mm.

6. The base substrate and sight substrate are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal reinforcement means in the union plane, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means normal to the union plane.

7. The multidirectional holding means provide a strong and stable bond between the base substrate and sight substrate, preventing displacement or change of dimensions.

8. The invention also proposes the use of a glaze from the supplier, eliminating the time and inconvenience of applying the glaze during installation, and providing improved composed stave floors with increased durability.

9. The example embodiments of the invention have been tested and shown to provide floors with increased durability, allowing for corrective maintenance and preserving the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention is a ladder attachment designed to improve the lateral stability of a ladder, prevent it from slipping or sliding, and increase the contact area with the work surface without damaging it.
2. The attachment includes a brace assembly with a flange that encircles a rung of the ladder, a U-bolt that secures the flange to the rung, and a clamp that holds the assembly in place.
3. The invention allows the ladder to straddle corners and provides a non-slip gripping portion that effectively increases the contact area of the ladder with the work surface, improving its lateral stability and preventing damage to the work surface.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, defining a collar portion that captures or at least substantially encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion extending between and connecting adjacent collar portions.

2. The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer such as a polyolefin, a polyolefin blend, an epoxy, or the like. When the fastener is driven from the driving tool, the collar portion remains adhered to the fastener such that the collar portion penetrates the substrate with the fastener.

3. The connecting portion can be formed as a bridge and a rib in which the bridge and rib have a generally cruciform shape. The rib can be formed parallel to the collation or at an angle to the collation.

4. The collation system includes upper and lower plastic moldings adhered to the fasteners. The upper and lower plastic moldings are formed parallel to one another, with the upper molding formed nearer to the head of the fastener and the lower molding formed nearer to the tip of the fastener.

5. A method for making a fastener assembly includes arranging a plurality of fasteners in a row parallel to one another, preheating the plurality of fasteners to elevate the temperature of the fasteners, molding a polymer material onto the preheated fasteners and between adjacent fasteners to form a plastic collation, and cooling the strip to form the fastener assembly.

6. The fastener assembly can be configured to influence or encourage separation of the fasteners from one another at a desired location. This can be achieved by forming a preferentially weakened region in the connecting portion, such as a notch or a varying cross-sectional area.

7. The collation system can be designed to minimize or eliminate corrugation and reduce the amount of debris generated when the nail is driven into the substrate. This can be achieved by various configurations, including tapered connecting portions, thinned areas, and selectively weakened regions.

</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in various industrial applications, including aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
2. The nozzle has a bell or hood-shaped lower section and an injection button with a special design, which allows for precise sealing operations.
3. The nozzle is designed to be used with both manual cartridges and automatic injection machines, providing versatility in its application.
4. The nozzle has a bell-shaped section that can encapsulate rivets or nuts, allowing for a complete coverage with the sealing material.
5. The injection button has multiple series of radially oriented channels and orifices, which enable different precision sealing operations.
6. The nozzle can be used to apply sealants manually or by an extrusion or manual gun, and it provides a perfect seal from air and oxidizing liquids.
7. The nozzle can be easily modified to apply sealing cords, filler sealant, or safety cords, making it a versatile tool for various sealing applications.
8. The invention reduces the sealant application time, saving time and labor, and provides a more economical and higher-quality sealing process.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention is a position sensor that uses a waveform generator and an error correction generator to modify a sensing signal and provide a conditioned sensing signal to a remote monitor via two wires, making it suitable for multiplexing multiple sensors.
2. The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about a position of an object being sensed, and includes a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit to constantly compare the sensor output to a desired minimum value.
3. The sensor system baseline is adjusted to a desired position with all offset corrected, and the components of the sensor operate to begin increasing the output of the DAC in order to compensate for an increase in value, while minimizing the increase and decrease in the output to avoid affecting the dynamic signal generated by the transducer.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention is a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines that eliminates the need for springs and provides a substantially infinitely variable valve actuation system. This system is capable of precisely controlling the percentage of port opening in each piston separately or in unison, allowing for efficient and effective control of valve port openness in concert with the requirements of the operation of a vehicle.

2. The system consists of a reciprocating cam translating device coupled to a rotary cam, which receives an input from a timing belt driven by the engine's output shaft. The rotary cam has a grooved track in a circular flat disk that displaces a translating means, which is a ball constrained in a slide that reciprocates in a slot to achieve the first reciprocating linear movement.

3. The system also includes a control feature that allows for variable displacement of the valve, enabling the valve to be closed indefinitely while the engine is running. This is achieved through the rotation of a circular disk with a slot, which is controlled by a pin that extends beyond the housing and rotates in a circular slot segment. The rotation of the circular disk adjusts the angle of the slot, allowing for incremental adjustment of the valve displacement from zero to its maximum value.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs, which includes a housing with a top side and a bottom side, a lighting control region disposed on the bottom side, and one or more light-emitting modules that are releasably coupled to the lighting control region to emit white or blue light.
2. The light member includes a switch coupled to the housing to control the first control channel, and the control channels can be controlled independently of each other, enabling variable functionality and output options in a small and focused footprint.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine that operates at high temperatures, aiming to improve upon the existing designs of cooled stator blades or rotor blades for gas turbines.

2. The prior art flow deflection apparatuses, such as stator blades or rotor blades in a gas turbine, are subjected to ambient temperatures above the maximum permissible material temperature, requiring special internal cooling channels to reduce metal temperature.

3. The known cast separating walls and deflection devices have several disadvantages, including a difficult-to-cool transitional region, thermal stresses between the separating wall and the hot-gas wall, increased blade weight, and complex casting processes.

4. The invention aims to provide a cooled flow deflection apparatus that avoids these disadvantages by constructing the separating walls as separate inserts, which are inserted into the apparatus and secured.

5. The use of inserts composed of metal or non-metal materials has several advantages, including reduced material in the transitional region, no thermal stresses, reduced blade weight, and simplified casting processes.

6. A first preferred embodiment of the flow deflection apparatus is a hollow casting with integrally formed holders in the form of rails, into which the separating walls are inserted, simplifying assembly and attachment of the inserts.

7. A second preferred embodiment of the invention secures the inserted separating walls by connecting them with an integral material joint, such as soldering or welding, to the flow deflection apparatus.

8. The separating walls can be straight or bent into a U-shape, and can be secured on one or more sides, for example by soldering or welding, and fixed in the blade tip region or in the blade root region.

9. The invention can be applied to various types of blades, including rotor blades for gas turbines, and can be used to simplify the production process and improve the cooling efficiency of the apparatus.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, which can be switched between manual and automatic control. The system comprises a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor that automatically sets the throttle position for optimum vehicle performance.
2. The control system allows the vehicle driver to switch between automatic and manual control, and provides full operation of the vehicle when in manual control. The system also includes a clutch that connects the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve when manual control is desired, and a logic sequencer that drives the phase drivers for a stepper motor.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or directly from waste fuels such as wood waste, aiming to provide a clean burning waste fuel burner.

2. Conventional wood waste fuel burners have been extremely inefficient in combustion, discharging undesirable amounts of gaseous and particulate pollution.

3. The invention aims to provide a waste fuel burner that emits discharges of very minimal quantities of particulate materials within the levels permitted by local environmental regulations.

4. The burner includes a primary combustion chamber where preheated underfire air percolates up through a conical pile of waste fuel, drying and gasifying the waste fuel.

5. The volatile gases driven off the pile are then partially oxidized by additional combustion air introduced tangentially with a very vigorous swirl in the primary combustion chamber.

6. The swirl air forces particulate out of the gas stream leaving the primary chamber, and the volatile gases move around a disc-shaped flame holder into a secondary combustion chamber.

7. In the secondary combustion chamber, secondary combustion air is introduced to an amount above stoichiometric proportions for complete combustion, and the combustion air is directed tangentially.

8. The invention allows for the adjustment of the amount of high-pressure swirl air admitted to the primary chamber based on the primary chamber exit temperature.

9. The burner can operate with a low volume of fuel or a high volume of fuel, and the feed of fuel can be controlled quickly, giving a response time in changing the output Btu/hr of the heater of less than 1 minute.

10. The discharge gases from the secondary chamber can go direct to the boiler, and because of their cleanliness, the boiler can be small and obtain high heat transfer by maintaining the high velocity of the gases.

</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention pertains to the field of evaporative refrigeration, providing a highly efficient apparatus for cooling air without the addition of water vapor to the useful air. 
2. The device operates by using a heat exchanger that separates its dry and wet sides, with evaporating water kept separate from the useful air to achieve sensible cooling.
3. The working air is drawn from the load (enclosure to be cooled) to the wet side of the heat exchanger, and the major portion of useful air is fresh air passing through the dry side of the heat exchanger.
4. A specific embodiment of the invention utilizes an array of spaced vertically directed hollow elongated tubular members, with the wet side accomplished by gravity flow of water downwardly along the inner surfaces of the tubes in conjunction with countercurrent flow of returned air.
5. The dry side is accomplished by fresh air flowing in thermal conductive contact with the outer surfaces of the tubular members for cooling thereof, with the cooled fresh air being delivered to the enclosure.
6. The invention can be modified to include a hybrid system, where a minor portion of the cooled air stream is further cooled by heat exchange with the evaporator of a vapor compression refrigeration unit.
7. The hybrid system can achieve significant reductions in energy required to operate the vapor compression refrigeration unit, resulting in a power requirement of only 50% of normal.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention relates to a fluid pump that can pump fluids at high volumetric flow rate and high pressure, particularly for pumping liquid manure from a reservoir.

2. The fluid pump comprises two or more pump heads configured in series, with each pump head having a housing, an impeller, and a drive structure.

3. The pump heads are connected to provide rigidity and a fluid seal between them, and the drive structure is configured to commonly drive the impellers.

4. The fluid pump has at least two fluid conduits per pump head, which combine into a single flow of fluid before exiting the pump head.

5. The pump assembly comprises a fluid pump mounted on a support structure, which can be a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer.

6. The fluid pump can be used for various applications, including pumping liquid manure from a reservoir, and can be driven by a single power source, such as a motor.

7. The pump heads can be connected to provide modularity, allowing for easy maintenance and repair, and the pump can be designed to accommodate different numbers of pump heads.

8. The fluid pump can be used in various configurations, including with a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer, and can be used for various applications, including pumping liquid manure from a reservoir.

</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention relates to engine compression release brakes and more particularly to engines having engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders.

2. Traditional engine compression release brake systems typically include an engine brake for each engine cylinder, but this can result in excess components and reduced overall robustness of the engine.

3. The present invention is directed to overcoming the problem of excess components in engine compression release brake systems by providing a sufficient, but reduced, number of components.

4. In one aspect of the present invention, an engine includes an engine housing defining a plurality of engine cylinders, and an engine compression release brake is provided for each of a portion of the engine cylinders, wherein the portion is less than all of the plurality of engine cylinders.

5. The engine compression release brake system includes a low pressure reservoir, a high pressure pump, a hydraulic system, and an electronic control module that controls multiple aspects of engine operation, including fuel injection timing and engine compression release brake timing.

6. Each cylinder has a movable piston, a fuel injector, a cam actuated exhaust valve, and a hydraulically actuated engine compression release brake that is operably connected to the exhaust valve for the cylinder.

7. The engine compression release brake includes a poppet valve member, a spool valve member, and a piston that are movable between an upward, retracted position and a downward, advanced position, and are controlled by an electrical actuator.

8. The engine compression release brake system can be modified to include different numbers of engine brakes, and can be used with engines having any number of cylinders, and can include any number of engine brakes that is less than the total number of cylinders and that is capable of providing sufficient engine braking horsepower for the engine.

</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure, such as an auxiliary gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads caused by events like blade-off in aircraft gas turbine engines. The mounting link includes a female link, a male link, and a pin that selectively retains the links and allows them to translate relative to each other.

2. The female link receives the male link to form a radial interface that dampens the translation of the male link relative to the female link. The pin can be designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly, the unfused mount components, and the engine mounting structure.

3. After the pin is sheared, the female link and the male link are allowed to translate relative to each other, and the frictional radial interface between them provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by the translation. The amount of coulomb damping is determined by the coefficient of friction, the geometry, and the contact areas of the female link and the male link.

4. The use of the pin and the coulomb damping provided by the radial interface obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to be capable of surviving the extreme loads produced during fan blade-off events, which would otherwise either be entirely infeasible or would dramatically increase the weight and mass of material required to adequately reinforce associated systems.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to archery equipment and provides a point cap system that is small, lightweight, and adjustable in weight to achieve perfect balance. The system includes a point cap and a balance pin that can be varied in size to adjust the weight.
2. The invention also provides a point adaptor that is internally threaded and can be attached to an arrow shaft using an adhesive, allowing for the attachment of various types of arrow points with external threads.
3. Additionally, the invention includes a nock cap that provides fluid communication between its ends, allowing air to escape when inserted onto an arrow shaft, and a balance pin that can be used with an arrow point or a point cap to adjust the point weight.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention is related to military weapons and specifically to apparatus for simulating the sound and flash of small arms fire.
2. The invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for use with small arms training.
3. The prior art used electro-mechanical small weapons noise simulators, but they were expensive and had limitations.
4. The current method of using blanks and a blank fire adapter for the M16 automatic weapon is also expensive and produces sound levels below that of live round fire.
5. The invention aims to provide a cost-effective means for simulating small arms fire without modifying the weapon and without the use of mechanical actuation.
6. The invention utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system.
7. The expendable contains a plurality of rounds and is installed in a firing unit that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.
8. The invention produces sound and flash by the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion produced in a manner that utilizes the weapon's ejection port.
9. The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt.
10. The invention is designed to be a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash, and is intended to be an inexpensive means to provide realistic training using an actual weapon.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to an air intake device of an internal combustion engine that utilizes the dynamic effects of the air flow to improve the volumetric efficiency of the engine.

2. The known device comprises a tank, a valve, and valve activating means to open or shut the valve in response to the engine load, but it has been determined that an air inlet pipe placed upstream of an air cleaner should be as short as possible to obtain the most enhanced dynamic effect.

3. However, cutting the inlet pipe too short results in an increase in the noise from the air intake, and the present invention aims to provide an air intake device that will improve the performance of the engine by the best utilization of the dynamic effect, to reduce noise from the air intake.

4. According to the present invention, an intake device for an internal combustion engine comprises a tank defining a volume, a first pipe defining a first passage interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage, and a second pipe defining a second passage interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage.

5. The first and second passages are open to the intake passage at different locations with respect to each other, and the cross-sectional area of the second passage is smaller than that of the first passage.

6. A valve is disposed in the first passage together with a valve actuating means responsive to an engine operating condition, and the cross-sectional area of the first passage is equal to or larger than that of the intake passage.

7. The second passage preferably opens to the air intake passage at a location nearer the air cleaner than the location where the first passage opens to the air intake passage, and the cross-sectional area of the second passage is substantially equal to or smaller than about one-tenth that of the first passage.

8. The provision of the narrow passage in the pipe 6 constitutes a resonator which absorbs the noise, and the resonator effect can be determined by the relationship given in the equation f = c / (2 * π * s * l) * √(V / s).

9. The valve 7 is operated in a manner as shown in FIG. 2, and the valve operating conditions can be stored as a map in the control circuit 13, which produces a control signal for the solenoid valve 12 and thus the control valve 7, based on the engine speed sensor 14 and the throttle position sensor 24.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention relates to a two-part bracket for mounting speakers or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure, allowing simple mounting by connecting the two parts of the bracket together.

2. The prior art uses a pipe clamp with a U-bolt that requires a different size for each pipe diameter and often requires two people to install, which is a disadvantage.

3. The invention aims to provide a mounting bracket that can be used on various surfaces of different sizes and can be installed by one person in a simple and effective manner.

4. The mounting bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket to be mounted on a pole or surface and an adjustable bracket to be attached to the object to be mounted.

5. The adjustable bracket is positioned on the stationary bracket to mount the object on the surface or pole, and the invention provides means to mount a product on a pole, pipe, column, or the like, and allow the product to be easily aimed in a particular direction.

6. The invention is designed for one person to install a fairly heavy item, and the installer never needs to support the weight of the object and handle attachment hardware simultaneously.

7. The bracket assembly consists of two major components: a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, with tapered springs guiding the two brackets together during the initial mating.

8. The adjustable bracket can be rotated into a locked position, and the two mount halves snap together temporarily using integrated hooks and tabs, allowing for easy completion of the installation process.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The present disclosure relates to a combustion apparatus, specifically a burner that can be part of a system including a plurality of interchangeable or modular heat utilizing appliances.

2. The burner is designed to optimize efficiency and limit unburned fuel emissions, making it suitable for use with diverse heat utilizing appliances.

3. The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, with air flowing through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and around the fuel holder to support secondary combustion.

4. A shroud provides a second wall surrounding the outer wall, establishing a flow path for tertiary combustion air and providing an external surface cool enough to avoid burns.

5. The burner has legs holding the combustion chamber well above ground level and a pivotally coupled ash pan for storing ashes and a supply of water to extinguish burning embers.

6. A perforate food grate is pivotally coupled to the burner, movable to a deployed position above the flame and to a stowed position to the side of the combustion chamber.

7. The burner has manual couplings for removably coupling modular heat utilizing appliances to the burner, including closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer.

8. The burner includes a constricted exhaust outlet that channels products of combustion and secondary and tertiary combustion air towards the exhaust outlet, concentrating heat advantageously.

9. The burner can be equipped with a gas-to-gas heat exchanger for heating environmental air for space heating, and a pyrolyzer for pyrolyzing carboniferous materials.

10. The burner can be provided with a fuel feed feature to enable renewing the fuel supply during operation, allowing for continuous, long-term operation.

</summary>

<summary>
1. The current rotary internal combustion engines face significant challenges in maintaining efficient combustion and reducing the risk of structural failure due to uneven heating and thermal distortion, particularly in the area surrounding the spark plugs.

2. The traditional in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses in the water jacket passageway disrupts the flow of cooling fluid, leading to vapor film collection and reduced heat transfer, which can cause overheating and thermal fatigue.

3. A new design approach is proposed, where the spark plug bosses are staggered with respect to the centerplane of the coolant flow, allowing for a controlled flow regime and improved heat transfer coefficient at the spark plug boss surfaces.

4. The staggered configuration of the spark plug bosses promotes high velocity flow through the passageway, devoid of uncontrolled swirling eddies, resulting in a higher heat transfer coefficient and reduced thermal distortion.

5. Experimental tests have shown that the staggered spark plug configuration can increase the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44% compared to the traditional in-line arrangement, making it a more efficient and effective design for rotary internal combustion engines.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention is a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing, and it uses control valve positions as feedback to minimize such flow disturbance.

2. The method involves maintaining the total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves constant, which minimizes steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes during inlet control valve testing.

3. The flow is determined as a function of control valve position, and the flow change due to closure of one of the parallel flow paths during valve testing results in a change to the system that is controlling pressure from N valves to N-1 valves.

4. The test compensation circuit uses control valve positions as feedback and compensates by adjusting the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of turbine control valve during testing.

5. The use of the control valve test compensating control of the present invention reduced the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main (throttle) steam pressure by 95% compared to a control system without flow compensation.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention relates to a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, specifically designed for an aircraft cleaning apparatus with two inlets and one outlet, allowing the mixture to range from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid.
2. The valve system consists of a valve body, a spool valve, and a flow restricting device, which allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of the two fluids emerging from the outlet passage, from approximately 0% water, 100% soap solution, to 100% water, 0% soap solution, while maintaining essentially constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas, where the gas is compressed to a higher pressure, cooled by heat exchange, and then fed for further transportation to the pipeline with a lower exit temperature and increased exit pressure.

2. The conventional method of cooling the compressed gas using re-cooling plants with separate cooling cycles is expensive and poses safety problems due to the use of propane as a cooling agent.

3. The present invention proposes a method of compressing gas where the gas is compressed to an excess pressure above the desired exit pressure, cooled by heat exchange, and then expanded to the desired exit pressure to achieve the required exit temperature.

4. The excess pressure is selected to ensure that the cooling during expansion is sufficient to obtain a temperature reduction to the desired exit temperature.

5. The expansion can be carried out using a valve or an expansion turbine, which can also recover mechanical energy and utilize it to provide a portion of the drive energy for the compression of the gas.

6. A preferred embodiment of the invention provides for a three-stage compression process, where two primary compression stages are equipped with compressors having approximately the same pressure ratio, and an additional compression stage includes a booster compressor.

7. The use of expansion turbines in the three-stage compression process allows for the recovery of drive energy and reduces the specific energy consumption of the compressor station.

8. During the cold season, the compressor station can be operated differently by switching the valves to obtain a parallel operation of the compressors, which reduces the energy consumption and increases the availability of the plant.

9. The present invention provides a more efficient and cost-effective method of compressing gas in a compressor station, with a reduced investment requirement and lower risk of accidents compared to conventional re-cooling technology.

</summary>

<summary>
1. Electronic components produce heat during operation, and in some applications, free convection cooling is not sufficient to prevent overheating. In such cases, electric fans are often used to move ambient air across the components at a higher rate.

2. Traditional fastening techniques for securing cooling fans to an enclosure, such as using screws or rivets, can significantly increase the cost of the product due to labor and handling costs.

3. The present invention discloses a system for eliminating fasteners traditionally used for securing cooling fans to an enclosure. The system includes a motor carrier with mounting legs that have turned-out portions, which are inserted into recesses on the panel, and spring members that urge the motor carrier away from the panel.

4. The installation process involves bringing the cooling fan assembly adjacent to the panel, applying a compressive and rotating force to compress the spring members and move the turned-out portions into the recesses, and then rotating the assembly further to capture the leg portions within the residual openings, resulting in a secure and vibration-resistant installation.
</summary>

<summary>
1. Spacecraft structures require the use of advanced lightweight and stiff composite materials, but these materials have very little inherent damping or vibration dissipation characteristics, leading to high vibration levels that compromise instrument functionality.

2. Precision kinematic mounts (KM) have very little inherent damping, accentuating instrument vibration environment during flight, and 14% of spacecraft launches through 1984 suffered vibration/shock related failures, with 50% resulting in catastrophic mission loss.

3. Current efforts to define graphite structure modifications to lower vibration response may not be sufficient, and additional vibration reduction techniques for instruments are needed.

4. The present invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads and achieve modal vibration tests on coupon sample mounts with modal damping values from 5-17% of critical damping.

5. The invention modifies kinematic mounts by inserting vibration damping materials into the mounts, which introduce a damping mechanism into the six mount suspension modes, dissipating high energy disturbances to the instrument.

6. The damping mechanism can be provided at machined hinge or flexure locations of the mounts, and two embodiments of the damper design are depicted in FIGS. 3A and 3B, using a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper, respectively.

7. The spherical damper uses a spherical damper composed of two partial shells connected via a viscoelastic (VEM) damping material, which induces shearing deformation in the VEM to dissipate vibration energy in the form of heat.

8. The cylindrical slot damper uses a series of o-rings or VEM washers placed within slots, inducing compression/tension into the VEM to dissipate vibration energy, and can be used in a variety of configurations, including a center-of-gravity mounting system.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention is a novel and improved clutch unit that overcomes the disadvantages of previously known constructions, especially when applied to large size power transmission requirements. It provides a strong coupling force between the plates and discs while maintaining high control accuracy in accordance with various input conditions.
2. The clutch unit utilizes hydraulic fluid for the dual purpose of retracting the plate actuating means to reduce residual drag and as a coolant for the clutch discs. It also allows for the replacement of portions of the clutch discs without requiring complete disassembly of the unit.
3. The invention features a segmental disc arrangement that minimizes the deleterious effects of heat on the discs, convenient inspections of the disc segments without requiring total disassembly of the unit, and retraction of the discs achieved via the centrifugal force of the oil, which obviates the need for retraction springs.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention describes a combined engine system that includes a combustion cylinder and an expansion cylinder, where the expansion cylinder receives hot exhaust gas from the combustion cylinder and also receives a source of water that is expanded into steam by the hot exhaust gas to create further drive for a common crankshaft.

2. The system aims to minimize heat loss and maximize thermal-to-mechanical energy extraction, with the goal of eliminating the need for a radiator. This is achieved through the use of multiple expansion cylinders, water injection, and a water recovery system.

3. The system also includes features such as catalytic conversion of impurities in the gases, water recovery and re-use, and gearing between the expansion cylinder and the combustion cylinder to optimize output and reduce back pressure.

</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention concerns the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel intended to be welded and then heat treated to obtain parts having good mechanical characteristics and good corrosion resistance.

2. The current fabrication method has difficulties when welding coated steel blanks, as a portion of the initial surface pre-coating is transferred into the molten area created by the welding operation, leading to the formation of intermetallic areas that reduce the deformability of the welded joints.

3. The inventors have shown that eliminating a precise portion of the coating solves the problems referred to above, and a plate according to the invention consists of a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of a layer of intermetallic alloy in contact with the substrate, topped by a layer of metal alloy.

4. The precoat is preferably an alloy of aluminum or based on aluminum, and the metal alloy layer of the precoat preferably comprises, by weight, from 8 to 11% of silicon, from 2 to 4% of iron, the remainder of the compound being aluminum and inevitable impurities.

5. The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed is preferably between 0.2 and 2.2 mm, and the width of the area from which the metal layer has been removed can be produced by partly eliminating the metal alloy layer on at least one precoated face of the plate by brushing or by means of a laser beam.

6. The invention also provides a method that includes the steps of coating a steel plate to obtain a precoat including an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer and, then, on at least one face of the plate, removing the metal alloy layer in an area at the periphery of the plate.

7. The method of the invention also includes heating the welded blank to form a surface alloying treatment and austenizing of the base steel, followed by hot deformation of the blank to its final shape as a part.

8. The parts obtained by the method of the invention have good mechanical characteristics, good corrosion resistance, and satisfactory ductility, making them suitable for the fabrication of safety parts, such as anti-intrusion or underbody parts, reinforcing bars, B-pillars, for the construction of automotive vehicles.

</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention is a supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) system for a mobile structure that recovers naturally occurring energy from severe weather patterns, such as wind and water currents.

2. The system optimizes efficiency by accounting for data from weather observations, sensors on the mobile structure, and performance models for the mobile structure itself.

3. The SCADA system includes computer servers that gather data through diverse means, such as Global Position Satellite (GPS) systems, weather satellite systems, and geographic and weather data resources.

4. The system runs Human Machine Interface (HMI) secure software applications that communicate to microprocessor systems running client software with a Graphical User Interface (GUI) to allow remote humans to interact and choose mission-critical navigation plans.

5. The system comprises an algorithm that optimizes energy extraction using yield functions derived from weather and geospatial data and vessel performance models, and can guide navigation of vessels for logistics-only purposes past severe weather patterns.

6. The system includes a control and communications microprocessor system on the mobile structure, which communicates with a central service facility through a wireless physical medium, such as a point-to-point Code Division Multiple Access (CDMA) system.

7. The system provides a Graphical User Interface (GUI) on client workstations at the central service facility, which allows humans to interact with the system, view data, and control the mobile structure's behavior, including navigation, energy extraction, and avoidance of physical objects.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction, which are manufactured using forming production steps. The invention also relates to a method for manufacturing such a rolling body guide cage.

2. The rolling body guide cage is composed of a ring element produced from a sheet metal material, which has an axial profiling formed by forming techniques and several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction. The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction and connected, in particular welded, to one another in a production step which precedes the formation of the axial profiling.

3. The flat material ring segments are preferably cut out from a sheet metal material, and a relatively high material saving can be achieved by forming the flat material ring segments as 120° ring segments. Only three weld points are then required for joining together a ring element from such flat material ring segments.

4. The ring element can be produced using a method in which the ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments which are joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction, and the ring segments are welded to one another in the region of a joint formed by these flat material ring segments. The welding can be performed by laser welding, and the ring segments can be produced with a slight oversize and further cut and calibrated after welding in the context of a contouring step.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The document describes a system for obtaining information related to a customer service location, including a method for requesting and obtaining coordinates associated with the location.
2. The system includes a technician server that directs a global satellite positioning system to obtain the coordinates for the customer service location.
3. The coordinates are then updated in one or more databases, which may include a customer record system and an address guide system.
4. The system also includes a mapping system that provides travel or routing directions to a service technician from a first location to at least a second location.
5. The mapping system uses latitude and longitude information provided by the technician server to generate driving directions.
6. The system uses a GPS system to track the location of service technicians and their input devices at customer service locations.
7. The GPS system interacts with a transponder system to obtain coordinates of the customer service location.
8. The system includes a dispatch system that receives, processes, and transmits information related to service required at customer service locations.
9. The dispatch system communicates with the technician server to process and transmit information related to actions to be performed at a customer service location.
10. The system uses algorithms to apply knowledge of service technician whereabouts and customer service locations to facilitate moving the next best or available service technician to the next highest priority or most appropriate service location.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic field compensation having two sensors and a digital processor. 
2. The system uses two real triaxial magnetic field sensors and three pairs of compensation coils to protect an object against influences of an interfering field. 
3. The control unit combines the six output signals of the two real sensors to three output signals of a virtual sensor using a freely definable kind of averaging, allowing the output signals of the virtual sensor to represent the amplitude of the interfering field at the location of the object to be protected. 
4. The algorithm used by the control system can be described as O=L·Ω(M·S), where O are the control signals, L is a 6×6 matrix, Ω is the control algorithm, M is the 6×6 matrix describing the averaging over the output signals of the real sensors, and S is the 6×1 matrix of the output signals of the real sensors. 
5. In case of two compensation systems being placed directly beside each other, feedback effects may arise between the two systems, which are accounted for by providing a 6×6 back coupling matrix C. 
6. The 6×1 matrix of the real sensor signals is expanded by the feedback part, and the 6×1 matrix with the virtual sensor signals is calculated from the signals Ŝ expanded by the feedback part, obtained in this manner. 
7. The control signals are calculated according to the relation O=L·Ω(M·(S−C·O)), where C is the 6×6 back coupling matrix, S is the 6×1 matrix of the output signals of the real sensors, and O is the 6×1 matrix of the control signals. 
</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using Coherent Anti-Stokes Raman Scattering (CARS) microscopy, where a resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering is sensed in image-producing fashion.

2. The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner, allowing for the introduction of a corresponding structure that is not inherently contained in the sample.

3. Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without appreciably interfering with natural processes, and can be used to introduce resonance sites into a sample that inherently does not possess them.

4. The method can be used to highlight or make visible chemical structures normally not detectable by means of CARS microscopy, and allows for the use of small molecules that can be introduced deep into a corresponding tissue.

5. The invention is particularly advantageous for tagging in biological samples, such as nerve tissue, where the intelligence of a tag can be combined with the specificity of vibrational spectroscopy.

6. The method can be used in combination with CARS microscopy to detect target sites in any samples, such as cells, without negatively affecting biochemical processes that may continue to occur.

7. The invention allows for a reproducible counter-staining of the non-resonant background in the context of CARS microscopy, enabling an improvement in the reproducibility of corresponding CARS methods and improved quantitative conclusions.

</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources, including comparing a "gold standard" segmentation approved by a clinician against segmentation provided by clinicians in training or different software systems, and/or comparing segmentation from different software systems against each other.
2. The system uses an electronic computer executing a stored program to receive two or more electronic segmentation files providing for segmentations for the same structure but from a different source, and to evaluate the quality of the segmentations or to evaluate the segmentation process by comparing the segmentations and providing a quantitative evaluation of the comparison.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to data processing systems and provides an improved apparatus for executing floating point operations, particularly for accelerating the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit.

2. The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation by calculating a difference between a subset of signal positions of an operand exponent argument, which is used to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions during the time that the difference between the complete operand exponent arguments is being calculated.

3. The subset is chosen so that when the complete difference is determined and the current procedure is determined to be the incorrect procedure, the correct resulting fraction is available, which is accomplished by providing that, when the operand fractions are shifted by an amount represented by any operand argument position not in the subset, the shifted operand fraction has a value of zero.

4. The apparatus implementing the invention includes a detection and logic unit, a shift and selection logic unit, a subtraction unit, and a selection logic unit, which work together to determine the final fraction result based on the difference between the subset of signal positions of the operand exponent arguments.

5. The invention accelerates the computation of the final fraction result by initiating the operation requiring a calculation prior to the determination of the difference between the complete operand arguments, thereby reducing the time required to execute the effective subtraction operation.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to the collection of blood and medical specimens in a medical facility, aiming to reduce or avoid mislabeling of specimen vials.

2. The prior art method of collecting a specimen involves a flow diagram with multiple steps, including entering an order to draw a blood specimen, printing barcode labels, and manually comparing patient information to ensure accuracy.

3. The present invention proposes a method of tracking a specimen acquired from a patient, which involves storing machine-readable codes on an identification (ID) means worn by the patient, an order to obtain a specimen, an ID means worn by a specimen-taker, and a specimen container.

4. The method includes selecting a specimen container with a unique machine-readable code preapplied thereto, reading and dispatching the machine-readable codes to a processor, and storing the codes in a relational manner in a computer storage.

5. The processor determines if the patient's barcode number and the order barcode number are related to the same patient, and if so, stores the blood drawer's barcode number and each vial barcode number in a relational manner in the database data structure.

6. The processor causes a signal to be output to inform the blood drawer to draw the blood sample and send it to a lab for analysis, and starts a software or hardware timer to determine the specimen collection time.

7. The lab receiving each vial containing a blood sample has all the order and "label" information stored in the database data structure linked to the vial barcode number, allowing for accurate processing without further paperwork or labels.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device that provides golfers with distance and other information on a golf course, and can be used for other applications as well.

2. The device uses voice recognition technology and GPS technology to provide the user with required data on the golf course and its parameters in a verbal electronically spoken form.

3. The device can be incorporated into an article of clothing, such as a hat or visor, and can use distance measuring technology such as infrared, optics, or Doppler acoustics.

4. The device can accept voice commands from the user, which are sensed by a voice sensor, such as a bone conductance vibration sensor or a microphone, and drives the voice recognition software.

5. The device responds to voice commands and provides an audible output by electronically produced spoken words, to provide distance and other information to the user via a loudspeaker or headphone.

6. The device can also be used to provide pre-recorded golf instructions to assist the golfer in making a specified golf shot, and can be used for other applications such as hiking, surveying, and hunting.

7. The device can be connected to a separate personal computer or similar technology provided by the user, to facilitate various detailed functions, such as graphical display of the user's score and plot of all ball trajectories viewed against an image of the subject golf course.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The present invention relates to the field of semiconductor design technology, specifically to systems and techniques used for implementing circuit designs into silicon-based integrated circuits (ICs), and aims to provide a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports appropriate errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, i.e., memory and logic.

2. The conventional methods of checking design rules have several disadvantages, including the need for manual checking and the possibility of false errors, which can slow down the design development cycle and cause real errors to be overlooked.

3. The present invention provides a system and method of checking design rules to determine whether or not a logic part of a mask pattern data obeys logic rules and the memory part of a mask pattern data obeys memory rules, which helps users filter out false errors due to logic rule checks in a memory block and pinpoint real design rule errors in the mask pattern data.

4. The invention creates customized rules appropriate for different types of memory regions that might be included on a chip, based on modifying a standard logic rule by "pushing" more liberal memory-based parameters onto a stricter logic-based parameter.

5. The system and method of the present invention can be applied to any mask pattern database, including one having no memory blocks, or even multiple types of memory blocks, and can be used to derive customized memory rules from standard logic design rules.

6. The invention ensures that all types of memory regions have to fulfill all memory rules of their group, and all logic regions have to fulfill logic and memory rules, making it a superior technique to prior art methods in terms of avoiding false errors and being more reliable, efficient, etc.

</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention described in the source document is a waveguide hologram (WGH) illuminator that provides controlled illumination of objects, such as holograms and spatial light modulators (SLMs), with high diffraction efficiency and minimal stray light. The WGH illuminator consists of a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser, and a hologram formed on the surface of the waveguide.

2. The WGH illuminator has several advantages over conventional illumination systems, including reduced volume, improved stability, and increased efficiency. However, it also has some limitations, such as alignment sensitivity, illumination depletion, and two-sidedness, which can be addressed through various techniques, including a priori and a posteriori compensation, and the use of off-axis illumination.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing squirrel cage rotors for induction motors to obtain the resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew of the rotor to permit identification of rotor defects.

2. Squirrel cage rotors for modern induction motors typically include a core comprised of a stack of steel laminations and an aluminum squirrel cage conductor arrangement, usually formed as a die casting.

3. Manufacturing techniques have been perfected to the point where these rotors are mass produced with a high probability of uniformity and high quality, but there are still possibilities for deficiencies such as porosity or impurities in the aluminum casting and open circuits in the squirrel cage conducting bars.

4. A novel and improved method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors is provided, which includes exciting means for magnetizing the rotor during angular movement in response to an alternating current.

5. The test apparatus comprises a test head for accepting and causing relative angular movement between the rotor and test head, and includes voltage sensing means for generating a voltage signal responsive to the magnetic flux variations generated by the rotor.

6. The apparatus also includes current sensing means for sensing the magnitude of the alternating current utilized to magnetize the rotor and for generating a current signal representative thereof.

7. Processing means is provided for determining the resistance and reactance of the rotor responsive to the voltage signal and current signal, and skew sensing means may be provided for sensing the effective electrical skew of the rotor.

8. The data acquisition and processing system controls the acquisition of the test data and processes the data to produce useful test results as well as rotor pass/fail determinations.

9. The system also controls the sequence of events that occur during a test, including the rotation of the rotor, the sampling of the voltage, skew, and current signals, and the processing of the acquired data.

</summary>

<summary>

1. The computing power of mobile devices is increasing, allowing for more sophisticated applications to be developed, but also making it necessary to protect the device from attackers who try to obtain digital rights management keys or device keys.

2. One way to secure the device is to "close" the mobile device by only allowing certain types of hardware and proprietary closed-source software, but this may limit the ability of third parties to develop applications.

3. An embodiment of the present disclosure provides a method that includes granting access to native resources of an operating system to a managed library in response to validating a digital certificate associated with the managed library.

4. The method also includes denying access to native resources of the operating system to a managed application, even if it includes a digital certificate authorizing it to access a specific native resource through the managed library.

5. The disclosure also provides a method that includes receiving a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library, authorizing the request, and sending a request to access the native system resource to a runtime host.

6. The runtime host can then access the native system resource, and the disclosure provides various embodiments for implementing this process, including using a title player to load and authenticate the runtime host and managed library, and using a manager to restrict access to native resources and enforce security policies.

</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention relates to an improved identification card containing an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers onto which artwork may be printed, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers.

2. The prior art identification cards and smart cards typically have a rigid core onto which an IC chip and antenna are positioned by means of glue or a mechanical device, and are then covered with a plastic.

3. The prior art methods of manufacturing identification cards and smart cards have several drawbacks, including the rigidity of the components used, the complication and increased cost of securing the antenna and chip with glue or a mechanical means, and the brittleness of the materials used.

4. The present invention provides a low-cost, easily constructed identification card having an antenna and chip incorporated into the body of the card, which protects these electronic components from damage.

5. The identification card of the present invention comprises a core layer, a bottom layer, and two polymer layers, with the core layer and bottom layer being formed of an opaque white reflective polyolefin, and the polymer layers being formed of an amorphous or biaxially oriented polyester or other optically clear plastic.

6. The identification card of the present invention may be personalized with a common inkjet printer prior to addition of the polyester layers, or may have a protective layer applied to protect the variable indicia and prevent bleeding of dye from the image-receiving layers.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention relates to the implementation of a memory, specifically a FIFO-type queue, in a functional memory environment. The solution is intended for use in connection with functional memories, where updates are carried out by copying the path from the root of a tree-shaped structure to the point of updating.

2. In traditional overwrite memory environments, a FIFO queue is implemented using a double-ended list, but this approach is ineffective for functional memories, resulting in the copying of the entire queue with each update.

3. The invention provides a novel way of establishing a queue using a tree-shaped structure, where additions and deletions are directed to the first non-full node or leaf node on the edge of the tree.

4. The tree-shaped data structure is maintained by adding new nodes to keep leaf nodes at the same hierarchy level, and the path from the root to the point of updating is copied from the structure with each update.

5. The solution reduces the amount of required copying, making it more efficient for functional memories, and each update requires a time and space that are logarithmically dependent on the length of the queue.

6. A preferred embodiment of the invention includes a separate header node that comprises three elements, each of which may be empty or contain a pointer, to simplify the implementation of the queue.

7. The header node allows for the inversion of the queue in constant time and space, and the queue can be used as a double-ended queue, enabling additions to the beginning and deletions from the end of the queue.

8. The invention can be implemented using a memory arrangement that includes a tree structure, intermediate registers, and control logic to maintain the queue and perform additions and deletions of records.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to electrically programmable random access memory (EPROM) devices, and more particularly to embedded EPROM devices manufactured by existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies. The primary objective of this invention is to provide practical methods to build embedded EPROM devices using existing IC manufacture technologies.

2. The invention utilizes existing circuit elements to build EPROM devices without complicating existing manufacture technologies. For example, DRAM storage capacitors are used as the coupling capacitors to build floating gate EPROM devices, and transistor properties changed under stress conditions are used to support EPROM operations.

3. The EPROM devices of the present invention have several advantages, including the capability to manufacture EPROM devices using existing DRAM manufacture technologies, larger coupling capacitors, and lower operation voltages. This simplifies the requirements on supporting circuits and reduces the cost of EPROM devices.

4. The invention also includes a type of EPROM device called "stress effect programmable read only memory" (SEPROM) devices, which use the damages caused by electrical stresses on common transistors to store data. SEPROM devices can be manufactured by any IC technologies and are ideal for embedded applications.

5. SEPROM devices have several advantages, including the ability to store large numbers of data at very low cost, the ability to store data that is not detectable by physical analysis, and the ability to support a wide variety of novel applications. However, SEPROM devices also have some disadvantages, including the potential for writing data to take longer time than writing to floating gate devices and the inability to be re-programmed for many times.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention relates to a technique of easily and quickly determining the optimum value of feedback gain used for calculating correction amount in feedback control, which is frequently adopted for moving an automatic guidance vehicle along a predetermined course.

2. The prior art method of determining the optimum value of feedback gain is the limit sensitivity process, which involves carrying out actual feedback control on the subject of control and determining the optimum value of each gain from the value of the P gain at this time in accordance with experiment rules.

3. However, the limit sensitivity process has problems in detecting the self-sustaining vibration, and it may be difficult to detect the reaching of the state of the self-sustaining vibration depending on the subject of control.

4. The present invention provides a method of determining feedback gain which permits determining the proper value of feedback gain both easily and accurately, in a short period of time and irrespective of the kind of the subject of control.

5. The method of determining feedback gain according to the invention comprises a first step of provisionally determining a predetermined value of a feedback gain, a second step of executing feedback control by using the provisionally determined feedback gain, and a third step of detecting an error between a designated value and an actual value of the subject of control during the execution of the second step.

6. The method further comprises a fourth step of calculating an evaluation value indicative of the character of feedback control according to the error detected in the third step, a fifth step of executing the second to fourth steps repeatedly a plurality of times after provisionally determining a new feedback gain value different from the previous value, and a sixth step of calculating a feedback gain value which can provide for a suitable evaluation value according to the relation between the feedback gain value and the evaluation value obtained through the execution of the fifth step.

7. The invention is applicable to cases of obtaining the optimum values of feedback gains other than the P, I and D gains, and the evaluation functions for the gains are not limitative, and it is possible to use other functions so long as they are suited for the gain evaluation.

</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range, while minimizing the physical size and total length of the lens system.

2. The zoom lens of the invention comprises five lens units: a first unit of positive power for focusing, a second unit of negative power for varying the image magnification, a third unit of negative power for compensating for the shift of an image plane, a fourth unit of positive power for making the diverging light beam almost parallel, and a fifth unit of positive, negative, positive, negative, positive, and positive powers for image forming.

3. The conditions for the construction and arrangement of the elements of the fourth and fifth lens units are crucial for achieving good correction of aberrations and high grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range. These conditions include inequalities for the refractive power of the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth unit, the refractive power ratio of the second lens in the fifth unit to the whole of the fifth unit, the refractive power ratio of the fourth and fifth lenses in the fifth unit, and the Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth unit.

4. The invention also includes a preferred condition for the refractive power of the second lens unit, which is crucial for achieving a reduction of the physical length of the entire lens system while minimizing the variation with zooming of the aberrations.

5. The invention has achieved a great advance in reduction of the size of the zoom lens in terms of the total length, with a total length of as short as L=9.13φ A  to 9.19φ A , while preserving high grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range.

</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention aims to provide a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, photons, or the like, by which the drawbacks of the prior art can be reduced or completely avoided. The method and device enable both the measurement or detection of individual particles and the integration of count rates, in particular upon exceeding of a given threshold value for signal rates.

2. The invention proposes that discharging of a charge pulse or signal from the detector is performed on the low-voltage side, which enables the detection of small-size signals and prevents the detection of an interfering leakage current in a high-voltage cable. The low-voltage-side discharge or wiring provided by the invention will, in particular, prevent a leakage current in a high-voltage cable possibly having a large length from being detected.

3. The device according to the invention includes a detector for generating a charge pulse in the detector when a particle passes therethrough, at least one consecutively arranged amplification device for converting every charge pulse into an electric signal and amplifying the same, and optionally a display and/or recording device. The device enables the detection of individual particles and the integration of each of a plurality of signals, and it is possible to adjust the measuring ranges for measuring individual particles or each integrating the same.

4. The invention can be used for detecting particles in particle accelerators, in reactor installations, in diagnostic devices such as X-ray devices, CT devices, or the like, and it has various applications in scientific examinations, medical technology, and electrical power engineering applications.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking a driven disc assembly, which is used in friction clutches to selectively connect a source of rotational power to a driven mechanism.

2. The prior test fixture for spin checking the driven disc assembly was slow and inefficient, requiring several manual operations and generating no external indication of whether the tested assembly was good or bad.

3. The improved apparatus includes an enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring, a torque motor, and a control system that automatically determines whether the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances.

4. The control system includes a microprocessor that reads signals from an optical encoder, a position sensor, and a sensor portion of the servo motor, and generates signals to control the operation of the torque motor and the servo motor.

5. The microprocessor executes a program that includes instructions to actuate the servo motor to move the movable ring toward the stationary ring, measure the distance between the rings, and actuate the torque motor to exert a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly.

6. The program also includes instructions to gradually move the movable ring away from the stationary ring, measure the distance between the rings, and determine whether the driven disc assembly has rotated at least ten degrees from its original position.

7. If the driven disc assembly has rotated at least ten degrees, the program determines whether the warpage of the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances by comparing the difference signal from the position sensor with a standard value.

8. If the warpage is within specified tolerances, the microprocessor actuates the servo motor to rapidly move the movable ring toward the right, allowing the operator to remove the driven disc assembly and install another assembly for testing.

</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention relates to face age-estimation and methods, systems, and software therefor, and is directed to the field of image processing.

2. Face recognition is a challenging task in computer vision due to large variations in human faces, and face age-estimation is even more difficult.

3. The invention aims to provide an accurate, efficient, uncooperative, and cost-effective solution to the problem of face age-estimation.

4. The invention uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to extract feature vectors from face images, which can represent both the shape structure of a face and its constituent parts.

5. The CAM algorithm is a combination of a modified active shape model (MASM) that represents the facial structure and a quasi-localized texture model that represents the pattern of contourlet-based intensities across a facial image patch.

6. The invention uses a statistical principal component analysis (PCA) model to build a linear model for the extracted appearances, and applies a further statistical PCA approach to the data to generate a final model.

7. The invention uses support vector regression (SVR) to construct two differently-calibrated aging functions, a growth and development mapping function and an adult aging mapping function, and uses support vector machines (SVMs) to build an age classifier.

8. The invention uses the CAM algorithm to extract feature vectors from the first image data, and then uses the age classifier to determine whether the individual represented by the first image data is a youth or an adult.

9. Based on the determination of the age classifier, an appropriate aging function is used to determine the age of the face, and an estimated age is generated using the growth and development or adult aging function.

</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, particularly suited for simultaneous display of two images with different definitions. The device comprises a controller and a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements of a predetermined number of pixels.

2. Each arrangement of pixels can be formed by a square of four pixels, with three pixels associated with light intensity signals for the first image and the remaining pixel associated with the light intensity signal for the second image. Alternatively, two pixels can be associated with the first image and two pixels with the second image.

3. The controller can apply an attenuation function to the light intensity signals of the pixels associated with the first image, depending on the quantified light intensity signal value of the remaining pixel.
